titleStmt.title: By the Kings most excellent Majestie, a proclamation. For as much as we have seriously weighed the present sad distractions that are, and have a long time been in our much enslaved and oppressed Kingdoms, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: Brussels, the 25 day of January 1659.
Steele notation: Roman letter. Arms 58 Our ment prospe-.
Pardon to all proveded they join him within 21 days after 1 February in Cornwall, or the North of Scotland 10 days later. -- Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
